content: Despite what any Presidential candidate claims before the Election, once the President is elected he can't alienate the Military and still have a Military. I think that we've seen part of this now, but maybe not all of it yet. This only works if every member of the Military keeps up with the latest news as often as possible - and not just sports or comics or cars or editorials or whatever. If somebody hasn't kept up for a few days, then try to ask somebody else who might have. Osher Doctorow
reply: Despite what any Presidential candidate claims before the Election, once the President is elected he can't alienate the Military and still have a Military. title: Lessons From Don't Ask Don't Tell

content: Are you saying the Politicians don't keep their promises after they get elected??? Todays politics remind me of an old saying. - "Ideas are more powerful than guns. We would not let our enemies have guns, why should we let them have ideas?" - Joseph Stalin
reply: Are you saying the Politicians don't keep their promises after they get elected??? Todays politics remind me of an old saying. - "Ideas are more powerful than guns. We would not let our enemies have guns, why should we let them have ideas?" - Joseph Stalin
title: Lessons From Don't Ask Don't Tell

content: Yes, it is quite common for politicians to not keep their promises after election. In fact, that may be when the public's role really gets more important - keeping them honest.
reply: Yes, it is quite common for politicians to not keep their promises after election. In fact, that may be when the public's role really gets more important - keeping them honest.
